sn22.64:1.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
sn22.64:1.3: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
sn22.64:1.4: “When you conceive, mendicant, you’re bound by Māra.
sn22.64:1.5: Not conceiving, you’re free from the Wicked One.”
sn22.64:2.1: “But how do you see the detailed meaning of my brief statement?”
sn22.64:2.2: “Sir, when you conceive form you’re bound by Māra.
sn22.64:2.3: Not conceiving, you’re free from the Wicked One.
sn22.64:2.8: Not conceiving, you’re free from the Wicked One.
sn22.64:2.9: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
sn22.64:3.2: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
sn22.64:3.3: When you conceive form you’re bound by Māra.
sn22.64:3.4: Not conceiving, you’re free from the Wicked One.
sn22.64:3.9: Not conceiving, you’re free from the Wicked One.
sn22.64:3.10: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.” …
sn22.64:3.11: And that mendicant became one of the perfected.
